sprintGoal: Implement job matching algorithm, Easy Apply, and application tracking system

tasks.title: Implement job matching algorithm backend
tasks.description: Create matching system scoring jobs against candidate profiles with 40% skills, tech stack, experience, location, salary alignment
acceptanceCriteria: Matching algorithm calculates score 0-100% per job-candidate pair
Factors: skills overlap (40%), tech stack match (20%), experience level (15%), location/remote (10%), salary expectations (10%), cultural fit (5%)
GET /api/jobs/:id/match returns match score with explanation
GET /api/jobs?match=true returns jobs sorted by match score
Match explanation: 'Top 3 reasons why this matches'
Skills matching: compare required vs candidate skills with proficiency weighting
Tech stack matching: models, frameworks, languages overlap
Location matching: remote preference vs job remote type
Salary matching: candidate expectations vs job offer
Interest signals: views, saves, applies boost score
Cache match scores (recalculate on profile update)

technicalNotes.algorithm: Weighted scoring: skills * 0.4 + tech_stack * 0.2 + experience * 0.15 + location * 0.1 + salary * 0.1 + culture * 0.05
technicalNotes.skills: Jaccard similarity on skill sets with proficiency weighting
technicalNotes.explanation: Return top 3 factors with highest contribution to score

tasks.title: Display match scores on job listings
tasks.description: Show match percentage and explanation on job cards and detail pages
acceptanceCriteria: Match score badge on each job card (e.g., '87% Match')
Match details panel on job detail page
Shows: match %, visual breakdown by factor (bar chart), top 3 match reasons
Hover tooltip on match badge shows brief explanation
Match score updates when profile changes (with notification)
Anonymous users see generic 'Create profile to see match score'

tasks.title: Implement Easy Apply backend
tasks.description: Create one-click application system auto-filling from candidate profile
acceptanceCriteria: applications table tracks all job applications
Auto-fill from profile: name, email, phone, work experience, education, skills, portfolio
Application status: submitted, viewed, screening, interview, offer, rejected, withdrawn
Notification to company on new application
Notification to candidate on status change

technicalNotes.table: applications (id, job_id, user_id, resume_url, cover_letter, screening_answers, status, applied_at, updated_at)
technicalNotes.status: ENUM: submitted, viewed, screening, interview, offer, rejected, withdrawn

tasks.title: Build Easy Apply UI and application flow
tasks.description: Create streamlined application modal with pre-filled data and one-click submit
acceptanceCriteria: Modal shows: auto-filled profile data (name, email, phone), resume preview
Screening questions form (if job has questions)
Profile completeness check (warn if missing key fields)
Close modal without losing input (draft save)
Application successful page with tracking info

technicalNotes.validation: Check required fields before enabling submit
technicalNotes.draft: Save cover letter and answers to localStorage temporarily

tasks.title: Implement application tracking dashboard
tasks.description: Create candidate-facing dashboard to track all applications and statuses
acceptanceCriteria: GET /api/applications returns user's applications with job details
Filter by status: all, active, interviews, offers, rejected, withdrawn
Include: job title, company, status, applied date, last update
GET /api/applications/:id returns full application with history
Status history log (submitted → viewed → interview → etc.)
Application statistics (total applied, interview rate, etc.)

technicalNotes.joins: JOIN jobs, companies for full application context
technicalNotes.history: application_status_history table logs all status changes

tasks.title: Build application tracking UI
tasks.description: Create 'My Applications' page with status pipeline and application details
acceptanceCriteria: Summary cards: total applied, in progress, interviews, offers
Status tabs: All, Active, Interviews, Offers, Rejected, Withdrawn
Application cards show: job title, company logo, status badge, dates
Status color-coding (submitted: blue, interview: yellow, offer: green, rejected: red)
Detail panel: full job description, application data, status timeline, messages
Empty state for each status filter

technicalNotes.stepper: MUI Stepper or custom timeline component

tasks.title: Implement saved jobs and job alerts
tasks.description: Add bookmark jobs feature and email alerts for new matching jobs
acceptanceCriteria: job_alerts table for custom alert criteria
POST /api/jobs/alerts creates alert (keywords, location, remote, etc.)
Daily cron job matches new jobs against alerts
Email sent with matching jobs (max 1 email/day per alert)
Saved jobs include deadline reminder (3 days before expiry)
Track alert effectiveness (jobs clicked from alert emails)

technicalNotes.tables: saved_jobs (user_id, job_id, saved_at), job_alerts (user_id, name, criteria_json, active)
technicalNotes.cron: Bull queue runs daily at 9am, checks jobs created in last 24h against alerts
technicalNotes.email: Use SendGrid template with job cards
technicalNotes.criteria: JSON: {keywords: [], location: '', remote: true, models: [], salary_min: 0}

tasks.title: Build saved jobs and alerts UI
tasks.description: Create saved jobs page and alert management interface
acceptanceCriteria: Save button on job cards and detail pages (heart icon)
Saved jobs display like job listings
Create alert form with criteria fields
Alert list showing active alerts with edit/delete
Empty states for saved jobs and alerts

technicalNotes.icon: Heart icon filled when saved, outline when not saved

tasks.title: Test matching and application features
tasks.description: Test matching algorithm, Easy Apply, application tracking, saved jobs, and alerts
acceptanceCriteria: Match scores calculate correctly and display accurately
Sorting by 'Best Match' orders jobs correctly
Application tracking dashboard shows all applications
Saved jobs page displays bookmarked jobs
Job alerts create and trigger correctly
Alert emails send with matching jobs

scenarios: Create profile, view match scores on jobs
Apply to job using Easy Apply

notes: Sprint 8 adds the smart matching and application features that differentiate Neurmatic. The matching algorithm is crucial - ensure accuracy and explainability. Easy Apply should truly be 'easy' - minimal friction.
risks: Matching algorithm may need tuning based on real data
Easy Apply may lack customization for some candidates
Alert emails may be marked as spam - ensure proper email authentication
